intro: Alloplectus calochlamys, commonly known as the golden crownbeard, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy yellow ray flowers surrounded by pale green disk flowers, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. Alloplectus calochlamys typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
